The Global Perspective: Understanding the Past, Looking to the Future

A Juried Exhibition

The GALLERY at Worcester State University invites artists to submit art for its first show since reopening after renovations. The Gallery at Worcester State exhibits art of interest to the college and regional cultural community, and contributes to the growth of central Massachusetts as a cultural destination.

Gallery at Worcester State University

 Ghosh Science and Technology Building

486 Chandler Street

Worcester, MA 01602

The Global Perspective:

Understanding the Past, Looking to the Future

A JURIED EXHIBITION

The phrase “global village” was coined by Marshall McCluhan over 40 years ago, but the meaning of that phrase has evolved in ways he could not have imagined. We invite work by artists that reflects the impact of living in a time when we are still connected to the past and our local identities, but we feel the effects of economies, cultures, and people in remote corners of the planet. What are the benefits and costs of our global connections? How do the lessons of the industrial revolution affect our future? What is the fate of a city like Worcester, with its origins in the industrial revolution, as it tries to redefine itself? How does the past continue to shape our present? Are we on the cusp of utopian opportunities or dystopian devolution? This show solicits work in any medium that engages with these themes.

Director: Catherine Wilcox-Titus, Ph. D.

Gallery Committee:

Stacey Parker, Amaryllis Siniossoglou, and Susan Fisher

508-929-8651

www.worcester.edu/gallery

Call to Artists

The Global Perspective

Worcester State University is pleased to announce a Call to Artists for its post renovation show opening October 20th and on view until December 1, 2011.

SUBMISSION GUIDELINES

Jurying will be done from jpg digital images submitted on a disk as jpgs 300 dpi.

Due at Worcester State University Gallery, 486 Chandler Street, Worcester, MA 01602 and postmarked by Friday September 16th. No exceptions.

Accepted artists will be notified by email of the acceptance of their work by Friday September 23rd. All accepted work must be brought to the Gallery (not mailed) on Friday, October 7th from 4-7 p.m. or Saturday, October 8th from 1-3 p.m.

Three (3) entries per artist, $25 entry fee, with $5 for each entry beyond three (3), payable to Worcester State University Gallery.

Entry Fee is non-refundable

 

Work must be submitted ready to hang. Space is limited for work that exceeds 40 inches in width and 7 feet in height. No work can be accepted that weighs more than 50 lbs. The Gallery reserves the right to refuse work that is not hanging ready.

INCLUDE IN YOUR SUBMISSION

• A disk with your artwork

(no more than 2 views of any given work)

• An image list that corresponds to your jpg numbers:

Example: Jones_1.jpg

• Artist’s statement

• Brief CV

• Check payable to the Worcester State University Gallery— $25 per 3 works, $5 for each

additional piece

 

Include the following information for each artwork you submit:
